arm_group.description: The intervention group will receive a 12-week intensive, weekly cognitive-based therapy intervention focused on improving dietary and physical activity habits.
Control group who will provide study data but will not receive the cognitive-behavioral intervention focused on improving diet and exercise

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to conduct a feasibility study of a diet and exercise
      intervention in measuring the impact of this intervention on (a) changes in percent
      adiposity and (b) on estrogen metabolites.  We hypothesize that the intervention group will
      have reduced percent adiposity and that this change will be associated with estrogen
      metabolites.

      Women between the ages of 35-65 years of age, who are at high-risk of breast cancer will be
      enrolled into the study and randomized into two groups: control and intervention groups.
      Both groups will provide biologic specimens, undergo Dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry (DEXA)
      scans, complete questionnaires and dietary recall interviews.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  High-risk of breast cancer according to Breast Cancer Risk Tool (BCRT)based on the
             GAIL model

          -  Women between the ages of 35-65

          -  BMI between >28 and <40

          -  Physically able to undertake a moderate to vigorous exercise program

          -  Ability to attend weekly group counseling sessions and clinic visits

          -  Agrees to be randomly assigned

          -  Ability to communicate in English

          -  Provides informed consent

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Previous diagnosis of invasive cancer within the past 10 years (in situ breast cancer
             and simple basal or squamous cell carcinoma not included)

          -  Contraindications for entry into a physical intervention program

          -  Regularly engaged in more than 90 minutes of moderate to vigorous exercise

          -  Abuse of alcohol and/or non-prescription drugs

          -  Planning to leave the geographic area for an extended period of time during the
             course of the study

          -  Transportation issues

          -  Women who are pregnant or planning on becoming pregnant during the course of the
             study

intervention.description: Intervention will include education regarding healthy eating, physical activity, and introduce mindfulness and experiential activities to assist participants in reaching their dietary and exercise goals.

clinical_study.official_title: Investigating the Role of a Lifestyle Intervention on Novel Estrogen Biomarkers

oversight_info.authority: United States: Human Subjects Division, University of Washington

primary_outcome.description: Percent adiposity as measured by a DEXA scan.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Mass Spectrometry analysis of EDA biomarker

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Prevention
